Choices:  A: article B: adjective C: interjection D: conjunction E: pronoun<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### A) Article<n><n>The word "article" can refer to a unit of a sentence that connects a noun to the rest of the sentence and is known for its function to determine a specific noun in the sentence. Article is used as a suffix in the plural form of noun, which is known for its function as a specific or a more generic term related to a certain group of people or a certain group of things.<n><n>### B) Adjective<n><n>The word "adjective" refers to the part of speech used to limit the meaning of a noun. Adjectives describe nouns, and may also limit the meaning of nouns by indicating the quantity of a noun.<n><n>### C) Interjection<n><n>An interjection is a part of speech that carries the meaning of expressing an emotion or feeling, and it serves as an independent sentence or part of a sentence. It is a short sentence, which is commonly used to express feelings, surprise, pleasure, pain surprise, etc. In the sentence, "Let's go away on vacation so soon", "so soon" refers an interjection that represents an emotion of surprise.<n><n>### D) Conjunction<n><n>Conjunctions are the part of speech used for joining two words, phrases, or sentences together. It can be distinguished according to the function of conjunctions. Some conjunctions join adjective clauses to independent clauses, while some others join adjective clauses or adjective clauses to noun clauses. <n><n>### E) Pronoun<n><n>Pronouns are used instead of nouns, and are used to refer to a noun. Pronouns include personal pronouns, which refer to individuals, and impersonal pronouns, which do not refer to individuals. According to the function of pronouns, they can be distinguished into a subject pronoun, object pronoun, adjective pronoun, or prepositional pronoun. <n><n>## Solution<n><n>### Solution 1(1 point)<n><n>```python<n>print('Hi')<n>```<n><n>### Solution<n><n>### Answer 1<n><n>```python<n>while True:<n>    n=input('Enter the value from 0 to 89')<n>    <n>    if n==0: <n>        break<n>    else:<n>

Choices:  A: deadly B: dangerous C: unconcerned D: stressful E: harder when weather bad<n><n>### Response:		Input: If you are driving too fast for the conditions, in this case ice, you are being dangerous.<n><n>### RATIONALE 1<n>Input: 'in this case ice' - here ice could be considered a 'condition'<n>Output: If you are driving fast on ice you are being dangerous. <n><n>### RATINALE II<n>Input: driving too fast for conditions - speed and conditions are variables<n><n>Output: if you are driving too fast you are being dangerous. (speed>conditions) <n><n>### Question:<n>What is the most suitable answer to replace 'unconcerned'?<n><n>Input: 'unconcerns me' - 'unconcerneds me' is not a formal word, if the question wants an answer that is 'unconcerning' to you, then the answer would be 'hazardous'.  If they want to know what would 'unconcern' me then the answer would be to be'stress' to me (as the dictionary says) then the answer would be dangerous.<n><n>Output:'stress'<n><n>### Extension:<n>If you are driving to fast on ice you are danger to the people around you in terms of your actions.<n><n>Rationale 1<n>- If you are driving too slowly you are stressful.<n>- If you are unconcerned you will be dangerous.<n><n>#### Other Options Considered:<n>- Hazardous<n>- Dangerous <n>- Stressful<n><n>### Input<n>John was driving too fast for conditions, thus he almost came to what? Choices: A: a sudden stop. B: a skid. C: a crash. D: a crashed <n><n>### Ext. Rational:<n>Input: John was driving too fast for the condition in which he was driving, thus he almost came, here almost came could also mean, almost came to a stop.<n><n>Output: John was driving too slow for the condition in which they were driving, thus he almost crashed (sudden stop)<n><n>### Rationale: <n>Input: If you are driving to fast for conditions, you are a going to crash.<n>Output: If you drive to slow, you are going to crash. (crashes faster)<n><n>### Ext.:<n>The conditions on the road are bad,

The question indicates that John did everything required of him but it was in a perfunctory manner, suggesting a lack of detail or thoroughness.<n>2. It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:What has happened to a person's money after he or she has used the last of it? Choices:  A: dissipate B: flown C: disintegrate D: fall apart E: penultimate<n><n>### Response:		<n>D. fall apart<n><n>### Rationales:<n>1. In a situation or circumstance where the remaining funds have been used up, the amount of money available has fallen apart. <n>2. The word “dissipate” implies that the money has been spent carelessly or unnecessarily, but it does not accurately capture the sense of the phrase.<n>3. “Flown” implies that the money was used for travel, but it does not capture the idea that the money is now exhausted.<n>4. “Disintegrate” refers to the process of breaking down or falling apart, but it does not necessarily mean that the remaining funds have been completely used up or are no longer available.<n>5. “Disintegrate”, in this context, could also mean that the person has used the last of the money, but it does not fully capture the idea of “falling apart”. <n>6. “Disintegrate“ only mentions using the last of the money but it is not completely used, so it is not the answer that the author was looking for.<n>7. Finally, the word “ultimate” is often used to refer to the last or most important thing, but the sentence doesn’t indicate ultimacy but rather the opposite.<n><n>### <n>Rationales:<n>1) The word “fall apart” indicates a breakdown or disruption of the funds, which is closer to the meaning of the rest of sentence.<n>2) “Dissipate” implies the wasting of funds through carelessness or excessive spending, but without mention of the funds being depleted.<n>3) “Flown” implies the use of funds for travel or transport, but does not indicate that the money is no longer available.<n>4) “Disintegrate” indicates the breakdown or breaking off of funds, but does not necessarily capture the idea that the funds are no longer available. <n>5) In sum, “fall apart” comes the closest to describing the sense of the sentence. <n>6) Thus, the answer to the phrasal usage is “fall apart”. <n><n>###

Here, "some unfinished business" is a general concept that requires some attention or action.  Hence, the option that appropriately completes this request is task. Other options refer specifically to the act of doing a task that someone has or hasn't done.<n><n><n>### Response2:As opposed to the more general idea of "task", "unfinished business" is used to emphasize that it's a particular piece or body of work that needs to be done. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The question indicates that John did everything required of him but it was in a perfunctory manner, suggesting a lack of detail or thoroughness.<n>2. It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:If I recieve a letter from a friend over seas, why might I read it? Choices:  A: pudding B: get news C: strain D: answer E: though<n><n>### Response:		<n>The given sentence is an example of a sentence which is unfinished, so the response should give an ending that gives it completion.<n><n>### Input<n>Because he knows he needs to go home to take care of his mother, Jim puts off going on his long awaited vacation.<n>Answer:<n>Because he knows that he must go home to take care care of his mother,Jim puts off going on his<n>long awaited vacation.

The question indicates that John did everything required of him but it was in a perfunctory manner, suggesting a lack of detail or thoroughness.<n>2. It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:What will happen if you are successful when committing suicide? Choices:  A: scars B: being born C: sorrow D: misery E: kill yourself<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer is D: kill yourself.<n>1. The question asks about what will happen if one commits suicide successfully.<n>2. From the provided options, the only one that suggests the possibility of dying is "kill yourself".<n>3. Among the other options, only D explicitly mentions dying, while A and B mention scars and sorrow, respectively, which are not sufficient to answer the question.<n>4. Out of the remaining options, only C, D, and E are allusions to dying in some form; however, both A and B do not make any direct reference to death.<n>5. Therefore, the answer is D: Kill yourself.

A person will either eat fish or die from starvation.<n>- Option B is a wrong because it is not logical or makes sense. A person will either steal or die from starvations.<n>- Option C is true because, when a person doesn’t have enough food he/she would talk to other food.<n>- Option D is also true because when a person doesn’n’t have enough food they usually write stories.<n>- Option E is wrong because we just had as answer that the outcome would either be Option A or Option B.<n><n>Answer: A: eat fish<n>

Choices:  A: fairgrounds B: friend's house C: space shuttle D: oven E: microwave<n><n>### Response:		<n>Food must be free from any organisms that might cause illness.<n><n>### Rationale: The question focuses on the importance of freeze-dried food when space travel, such as in a space shuttle or oven, is taking place. <n>By removing all the water from the food before it is consumed, there is no risk of spoilage or microbial growth. The question does not ask the vehicle in which the food is traveled, so the answer of "space shuttle" is not correct.<n>It is not "friend's house", since the question is asking about the necessity of freezing food for long term storage, rather than reheating food immediately upon arrival at a destination. <n>"Fairgrounds" and "oven" are incorrect since they are not vehicles.<n><n>### The answer is A: space shuttle<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following question<n><n>### Input : What was the original intention for the National Parks?  Choices  A: For the wealthy to live among them B: For people to appreciate them  C: For the government to own them D:  To sell land that was previously used for farming E: To preserve historical sites<n><n>### Response<n><n>The original intention for the National and State parks is for the population to appreciate them, both for their natural beauty and cultural interest.<n><n>### Answer - B: For people to enjoy them<n><n>### Justification<n>Firstly, the question states that the 'national parks are for people to appreciate' and not to 'live among them' or 'own them', which makes the answer B correct.<n>Secondly, D is incorrect since it is not mentioned in the question.<n>Thirdly, E is incorrect because the question mentions "appreciate them" which refers to "enjoying" national parks. The word'sell' is used and implies the purchase of land for some economic gain.<n><n>### If the original intention was for people to appreciate them, why did the government begin removing native populations from the lands?<n><n>Answer : B: Because in order to preserve nature, it has to be left undisturbed for many generations and therefore it must have the human beings removed. <n><n>### Instructiion: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Justify -

It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:If you harm property after starting a fire where are you likely to end up? Choices:  A: damage B: going to jail C: going to school D: burns E: destruction<n><n>### Response:		<n>Write a complete response that includes the name of the correct choice.<n><n>Damages are not unreasonable in court if there is a connection between the fire and the damages.<n>### Answer: If you damage property after starting a fire, you will likely end up in jail.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The question indicates that John did everything required of him but it was in a perfunctory manner, suggesting a lack of detail or thoroughness.<n>2. It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:A person is alone in the woods and wounded, what should he do? "John ordered a city" can mean two things.<n>3.  One is that he ordered a drink, which goes with Jane's statement. <n>4.  The other is that he ordered a city view restaurant. <n>5. The clue to this answer is the "reservation".<n>6.  "John ordered reservation" cannot mean a reservation for a place/city view.<n>7.  "John ordered clothing" is an illogical thing to do.<n>8. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The question indicates that John did everything required of him but it was in a perfunctory manner, suggesting a lack of detail or thoroughness.<n>2. It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:Where would a restaurant put a candle? Choices:  A: dimly lit room B: kitchen C: wall D: table E: birthday cake<n><n>### Response:		<n>The best response is C: wall.  Choices A-D involve putting the candle somewhere in a room, which seems highly unlikely for a restaurant.  Answering with E: birthday cakes suggests that there could be birthday cakes anywhere in the restaurant where there would already be a candle on a birthday cake.<n><n>### Sources:<n>1. [How to Write Multiple Choice Questions](https://takethisclass.com/how-to-write-quizes/multiple-choice.html)<n>2. [Better Multiple Choice Questions - Google Slide](https://www.slideshare.net/mrjaycarney/better-multiple-choice-questions)<n><n>### Discussion:<n><n>### The first part of this module was to describe a task that requires students to use multiple choice questions (mcqs) and the response to show the correct one was to write the correct answer.<n><n>### This is not my first time using mcqs.  However, this was the first time I've ever really taken into consideration how the multiple choice questions are actually *designed* to test students.  What makes a well written multiple choice question?<n><n>### The two articles I looked at made a few broad categories of multiple choice questions:<n><n>- 1. Single Choice Questions, where students select one response, no more, no less (Choices: A-D)<n>- 2. Multiple Choice Questions with more than 4 options (Choices: A, B, C, D, E)<n>- 3. Multiple Choice Question with more than 4 questions (Choices: A and B)<n><n>### These different kinds of multiple choice questions were used to help students improve their writing:<n><n>- 4. Single Choice Question with an answer that is not in the choices (Choices: A)<n>- 5. Single Choice Question where more than one response would be correct (Choices: D-E)<n><n>### I was shocked by the different kinds of multiple choice and the different kinds of responses that were considered "correct" or "acceptable".<n><n>### In my writing, the first part of the exercise instructed me to write the correct answer, but after observing the examples given, it seemed like it was also expected that
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The question indicates that John did everything required of him but it was in a perfunctory manner, suggesting a lack of detail or thoroughness.<n>2. It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:What is a child likely to do while going to play? It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:There aren't many anemone in what glove-shaped state? Choices:  A: michigan B: lake C: tide pool D: nursery E: atlantic ocean<n><n>### Response:		<n>D: nursery<n><n>### Reference:What's the difference between a glove-shaped ocean inlet and a nursery?<n><n>1.  Glove-shaped ocean is what? It means it's a large body of water that has rounded edges.<n>2.  Glove shaped ocean is an inlet between two oceans, this one being in Ireland, which is called the bay of fucking.<n>3.  There are two nurseries, the glove shaped one and the tide pool.<n><n>### Rationale<n><n>1.  The question asks to describe the difference between a gloved -shaped inlet and a nursey, which is given as the answer choices provided.<n>2.  Based on this information, it can be deduced that a "glove" can refer to a large, rounded body of water, like an inlet.<n>3.  However, an "atom" is a small, enclosed body of water, similar to a pool, and the word "atlantic" indicates that this nursery is located near the ocean.<n>4.  So the difference between a gloves shape inlet and a nurse must be that one is large and the other is small.<n>5.  Therefore, the answer must be "nurse" and "lake", which is found as choice B.<n><n>### Reference<n><n>1.  https://www.theatlantic.com/science/archive/2022/03/whats-a-norse/629307/<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The question indicates that John did everything required of him but it was in a perfunctory manner, suggesting a lack of detail or thoroughness.<n>2. It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:Where you have finished a conversation with a person what do you say? This goes back to adventurous always never giving up.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>### Input-Response Table<n><n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following true or false statement with TRUE if it is true and FALSE if it is false<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input" John's decision was made on the basis of the false assumption that the man had been thoroughly examined by a physician.<n>Choices:  A: false B: true<n><n>### Solution<n>- The expression "John's decision was made" doesn't follow the logical pattern that a truth table requires for it to be understood.<n>- If we assume this sentence to be a statement, it would take the following form:<n>```<n>X > (Y Z) <n>```<n>- In order for it to be a true statement, the following conditions should be met:<n>- There must be a ">", signifying that what comes after isn't necessarily a negation, but it does imply a comparison. The ">" is a comparison operator.<n>- There must be an "X", which represents a positive expression. Expressions representing both sides of the comparison must be of the same type and the same cardinality.<n>- There must also be two negations or "!" before the statement for it to be a negation. The statement "not X" is synonymous with "true if (X is false)" since they denote the same thing.<n><n>Within the above description, it is important to note that each condition is mandatory.<n>- Because there is no "!" after the "Y Z" expression, it is an absolute statement or a fact instead of a negation.<n>- Since the "X" isn't a negation, the entire sentence could be understood as follows:<n>```<n>(X > (Y Z))

An option that is a human that only produces milk is "woman".  Since "cow" is the answer, the other options are eliminated by process of elimination, leaving "cow" as the only answer choice.  The question could also be interpreted as meaning what animal is associated with milk, in which case, "cow" would be the only answer and "woman" would be eliminated.<n><n>Answer: The best answer is B: cow.<n><n>### Input:"My mother has many accomplishments that I aspire to," said my daughter. I have accomplished many of my goals E. She had many accomplishments<n>Rationales:<n> <n>1. If she says "I aspire to" and then gives a list of her mother's accomplishments, it can be interpreted as her saying that she aspires to match or exceed the accomplishments of her mother.<n>2. "My daughter reciting a list of her mother’s accomplishments" would be the equivalent of a direct quote and therefore, should be in italics.<n>3. The choices only include words or phrases used in the sentence, so the options do not seem relevant to the sentence.<n>4. The options do not explain why she is trying to say something (the given options do not match what she said).<n>5. However, the answer can be found if the passage is recontextualized.<n>The text provides some additional information.  It can be surmised that my daughter meant that her mother is an inspiration, or that she has accomplished many of her goals because she is saying that she aspires for all those things.<n><n>The correct answer is D: She had many accomplishments.<n><n>### Explanation:A question may have an unusual or ambiguous format, where the question itself could be interpreted differently, and thus, choosing an answer option does not necessarily reflect a wrong answer

Choices:  A: population B: populated area C: create government D: group of people E: make person sick<n><n>### Response:		D: group of people<n><n>### Rationales:<n>1. The question starts with a statement that society cannot exist without numbers.<n>2. It then asks: "They only rise up in what sorts of spaces?"<n>3. Among the available choices, the response should be "group of people".<n><n>4. The question implies that numbers cannot exist without society, implying a lack of a distinction between "number" and "group of people". <n>5. The question may have a different intention and the intended meaning is that people cannot exist without a society of numbers, since this is the only way society would have to exist.<n>5. However, the word "rising" in the question implies that numbers are separate entities, further indicating that people are distinct from numbers.<n><n>6. Therefore, the answer should be D: group of people since only this option indicates that people are distinct from the numbers.<n><n>7. The others options, A: population, B: populated area, C: create government, D: Group of people, and E: make person sick are irrelevant.<n><n>### Input:"We would be better off if you hadn't gotten involved in this in the first place."    Is that a threat, a bribe, or an insult? Choices: A: bribe, B: threat, C: insult, D: plea, E: request<n><n>### Rationale:<n>The question starts with a statement, "We would be better off…"<n><n>1) The question asks: "Is that a threat, a plea…?"<n><n>2) It is obvious that this sentence is a threat, not a plea or an insult.<n><n>3) The available choices are A: Threat, B: insult, C: Plea, D: Request<n><n>### Answer: Threat<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The question indicates that John did everything required of him but it was in a perfunctory manner, suggesting a lack of detail or thoroughness.<n>2. It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:Bill bought an upright piano but didn't have anywhere to put it because he lived where? Choices:  A: band B: music room C: college D: university E: house<n><n>### Response:		 C: Band<n>rationales: 10. The expression "Where bill lived" means he didn't have anywhere at home to put the piano, indicating that it was out of place there. <n>10. It is also mentioned he had an upright piano without anywhere to put (house), implying he did not have a suitable space for the instrument.<n>11. Thus, the option which best fits the context is "band", where musicians perform at school-related events.<n>12. "College" is where students study, "university" is where students work alongside professors to perform research studies. <n>13. "School" would be correct if there were a band or choir at school, but since this is not specified.<n>14. So the correct answer is c: bill live in a band.<n>Response: c:Band<n><n>### Input:"What was the real cause of death?" What would have happened if the physician had been more what?  Choices:  A. complete B. thorough C. careful D. thoughtful E. intricate<n><n>rationales:11. The question asks "What was the real cause?", implying the physicians examination did not address the ultimate cause of death.<n>12. One can deduce that the real cause of death was missed because he was not thorough enough, but not because he was careful, thoughtful or complete.<n>13. Of the provided options; careful, thoughtful, complete, thorough, or intricate.<n>14. The latter is the most suitable choice to describe a detailed and thorough examination.<n>15. In addition, "careful" may suggest cautiousness, however it does not necessarily connote attention to detail or depth of study.<n>16. Likewise, "thoughtful" would imply consideration, but without necessarily suggesting completeness or thoroughness.<n>17. Thus, the accurate answer is intricate, which is the only one that accurately describes a detailed exam.<n>18. Therefore, the most suitable choice to complete the sentence is intricate.<n><n>Response:Intricate.

What does the text say?<n><n>- The text suggests that there may be a city center.<n><n>2. What does the text do not say?<n><n>- It makes no mention about the bus having to stop somewhere and wait for the luggage to be loaded.<n><n>3. Is the suggested answer supported by what the text says?<n>   - The bus station is mentioned in the text.<n><n>### Analysis<n>In conclusion, my answer is the best answer to this prompt, as it is supported by the text.

Everyone enjoyed themselves, even my daughter who is shy.<n><n>### Input <n>She could tell that the new house was beautiful because when she and her father entered, the only thing her daughter what? <n>### Rationales<n>There is an opening question, which means that a response is required.<n>This is a multiple choice question, in which 4 out of 5 answers are wrong.<n>Hence an incorrect answer is the answer<n><n>### Rational<n>The answer should not contain "because" because it is inaccurate: an incorrect answer is not a direct result of something else, but is simply wrong.<n><n>### Rationale<n>An incorrect answer is different from "incorrect information" because both can be incorrect.  <n><n>### Response<n>C. The only thing her daughter did was look at the attic was not a correct answer.<n><n>### Response <n>Answer C is wrong, which means the correct answer must be D.<n>### Rational <n>If the answer is wrong, all the remaining 4 answers must be wrong, to which only answer 'C' was wrong, therefore, answer 'D'. This can be easily concluded based on the fact that in all the questions of this type there are 4, which means that out of those 4 questions 1 will be wrong<n>### Rationale 1 <n>It can be concluded from the fact that in each of these types of questions the ratio of true to false is greater than 1 and thus, one answer will be wrong <n>### Rationale2 <n>If in any of the questions there are 3 True answers then one false answer in a multiple choice question cannot be true<n><n>### Rules to Remember <n>1. In a test, all true answers are not always correct (There must be one wrong answer).<n>2. It is impossible for all the answers to be correct because the word "each" is used. This implies that only 1 answer will be true, which means 4 will be false.<n><n>### Example 1<n>He could eat all his what? <n>1. Desserts<n>2. D
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The question indicates that John did everything required of him but it was in a perfunctory manner, suggesting a lack of detail or thoroughness.<n>2. It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:What would cause someone to use invitro for reproducing? Choices:  A: problems B: offspring C: overpopulation D: larger family E: baby<n><n>### Response:		Option D: larger family<n><n>### Demystification:<n>There are several factors that can cause someone to use invetro:<n>1. Problems: This could include difficulties with fertilization or other health issues that make it difficult to conceive naturally.<n>2. Offspring: Some people may choose to use invitro because they are interested in having a large family.<n>3. Overpopulation: In some areas of the world, overpopulation is a major concern, and invitro may be used as a way to control numbers.<n>4. Baby: Some couples may use invitro to have a specific gender or type of baby.<n>However, these factors are not specific to invitro. For example, using in vitro to have a larger family or to control overpopulation can also be accomplished through other means like adoption.<n><n>The best answer to the question is E: Baby, as it is the only option that specifies a specific purpose for using invitro. Other choices may be used for other purposes, but Invitro is not always used only for reproduction.<n><n>### Inputs:What is the name of the man? Answer: Choices: A: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle B: Charles Dickens C: Mark Twain D: Robert Louis Stevenson E: Bram Stoker<n><n>### Demistification:<n>Arthur Conan Doyle was a Scottish writer best known for creating the character of Sherlock Holmes.<n>1. Sir Arthur Conan Doyles - Author of Sherlock Holmes Books<n>2. Charles Dickenses - Wrote A Christmas Carol<n>3. Mark Twains - Wrote The Adventures of Tom Sawyer<n>4. Robert Louis Stevensons - Wrote Dr. Jekyll And Mr. Hyde<n>5. Bram Stokers - Author of Dracula<n>6. Arthur Conan Doyle: Author of popular Sherlock Holmes books.<n><n>### Response<n>Additional instructions:<n>Answer the additional question that appropriately completes each request.<n><n>## Instruction:What does the man mean by this? There seems to be a problem with option A), since the airport is not a connection.<n>2. Option B), however, is a bit misleading, as we do not know if his connection is at the airport or a different place.  <n>3. Option C) seems to make sense, and its only explanation is the phrase "a connection".<n>4. In conclusion, the provided choices do not give sufficient information that we can say which one is correct.<n>5. In an effort to find out what they meant by the phrase "a connection", we can rephrase the question into "What kind of connection"?<n>6. After further review of the question, it appears that the connection is a computer network, since it says that it is "a couple of hours".<n>7. This is because computer networks usually use a data transfer rate of 1MB/s maximum and have a slower rate of access, causing any type of upload or download to take a while.<n>8. The context provided in the passage implies that the line is likely located near a road, as people would not typically stand in line near a water fountain or an apartment. <n>2. The word "fire" in "fire house" suggests that the line is likely near a fire station, which would be located near a road.<n>3. Similarly, the word "bus" in "bus stop" implies that the location is near a road. <n>4. This context makes the choice "near a road" more likely, and thus, the answer to the implied question is "near a road".

A: higher education B: lower education C: general education D: post secondary education E: pre college education<n><n>### Rationale<n><n>> Higher education gets taught in college, it's general education.  Post secondary gets taught in college.  Pre college and basic can both be taught in high school or other educational institutions.  Only higher and general pertain to college.  Lower, pre and basic don't.<n><n>### Solution for college graduation<n><n>> She'll get a general education in college.<n><n>### Possible solutions for the college education sentence<n><n>- Education in college is higher.<n>- She's going to get a higher education in college.<n>- She'll get higher learning in college.<n>- College can only be in higher education and post secondary.<n><n>### How to answer this type of question<n><n>> What kind of learning education? Choice: A: stories, prose, or fictional pieces <n>- What was the generation he was of? Choices: A: baby boom B: Greatest Generation C: Generation X D: Millennial <n><n>### Rationale:<n>1. The word "prolific" is defined as "characterized by great or rapid literary production; of, relating to, or productive of much".<n>2. Contextually, the word indicates a period of a lot of production or publication of literary work, of which the speaker's generation was capable.<n>3. Therefore, the correct response to the question must include the phrase "my generation" in it, indicating that the author was referring to his own generation - the speaker's generation.<n><n>## References<n><n>https://www.prepscholar.com/gre/blog/gre-vocabulary-list<n>

Pacific Ocean is the best choice among the provided options. <n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question:  When your brother is home, he tends to what, and the house is a wreck?<n><n>### Input<n>Dear John, please tell your parents to clean up their act.  To say your brother was disgusted would be an understatement.  It was obvious that they had a whole lot to learn.<n><n>### Response<n>The answer to the question "When your brother is home, is he tends to what,  and the house is a mess" is "A: To say your brother was upset would be an understatement."<n><n>### Rationale:1. The correct answer is a sentence that makes the strongest statement of the effect of an activity.<n>2. The "To say your brother was upsoet would be an understaement" sentence is the correct choice because it is the strongest statement of effect.<n>3. It shows that the person referred to is not only upset but their disgust can be easily inferred from what they described as an understatement.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The question indicates that John did everything required of him but it was in a perfunctory manner, suggesting a lack of detail or thoroughness.<n>2. It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:Why would someone confess to committing murder? Choices:  A: guilty conscience B: fear C: go free D: problems E: find god<n><n>### Response:		<n>Why would someone confess?<n><n>Choose from answers a, b, c, d, and e.<n><n>Choice a: guilty conscience <n>Choice b: fear<n>Choice c: go free<n>Choice d: problems<n>Choice e: find god<n><n>Option e is the correct answer. <n><n>Choice a is wrong.  This person could confess to get out of jail.<n><n>Choice b, fear, is also not an appropriate answer. <n><n>Incorrect answer: <n><n>Choice c, go free, indicates that there are problems with the law, which suggests an answer will be a letter or complaint rather than a confession.  This is not the right choice.<n><n>Option d, problem, is not an appropriate match because the question asks for a reason the person would confess, not the person who would confess, suggesting the right answer will be an external reason such as that indicated by choice d, not internal.<n><n>### Problem: Which is longer? Choices:  a: mile b: nautical mile c: astronomical mile d: geological mile e: fathom<n><n>### Rationale: <n><n>* Choice a, mile, equals the choice d, geological mile<n>* Choice b, nautical mile, equals the choice c, astronomical mile<n>* Choice e, fathom, equals the choice d. <n><n>### Answer:<n>The answer to the problem is e, fathom.

It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:If I am forgiving, what hidden force may be activated in my life? Choices:  A: nice feeling B: good karma C: respect D: new freedom E: good heart<n><n>### Response:		Answers:  A: forgiving<n>D: forgiving<n>E: forgiving<n>Rationale: The phrase "what hidden force may be activate in my life" suggests that the consequences of forgiveness may extend beyond the immediate situation or person being forgiven.  It may also refer to the hidden aspect of the process of forgiveness, which may be revealed upon deeper reflection or introspection.<n><n>### Response Options:<n>If the following responses are given, explain the significance of the chosen response.<n>#### Response: A: nice feeling<n>The response of choosing A: Nice feeling is incorrect because the hidden force may be activating in your life does not indicate a feeling. The passage also mentions "what hidden force may have activated in my life."<n><n>#### Response: B: good karma<n>The response of choosing B: Good Karma is incorrect because the hidden power may be activating in my life might suggest a personal power or energy activating instead of Karma. The word Karm might refer to the idea of a soul's journey, and not necessarily the concept of good or bad deeds.<n><n>#### Response: C: respect<n>The response of choosing C: Respect is incorrect because the hidden forces may be activating doesn't provide information about feelings or personal traits.<n><n>#### Response :D: new freedom<n>The response of choosing D: New freedom is incorrect because the hidden Forces may be activated can refer to forces of power or energy, which may not necessarily be associated with freedom.<n><n>#### Response E: good heart<n>The response of choosing option E is correct because  The option E: Good heart is correct because the passage states "what hidden Force may be activating in MY LIFE..." implying that the question is not only about good karma.<n><n>### Answer
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The question indicates that John did everything required of him but it was in a perfunctory manner, suggesting a lack of detail or thoroughness.<n>2. It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:What should you do if your pens aren't work? The numbers provided.<n>2. The list of estimated numbers needed to arrive at a number for each question.<n>3. The requirements for data sets.<n><n>### Solution: The table above can be arranged in sequence.<n><n>Example I:  72 x 5 = 360, 360 < 365, 65 < 165.<n><n>The answer to the first question is 65.<n><n>Example II: 25 x 5 = 125, 125 < 160, 90 < 165, 5 < 110.<n><n>The answer will be 90.<n><n>The data is listed out in ascending order, each value must appear before each of its value to answer the question.<n><n>## Input: What does the 144 mean in 1440?<n><n>## Response:<n><n>The 1440 stands for a calendar year.<n><n>## Data:<n><n>1. Choices:  A: get arrested B: problems C: sober D: intoxication E: pleasure<n><n>### Response:		<n>## Demonstration: 1. In this case, the question asks why someone might want to be buying a drink, and the answer choices are A-E, where A, B, and C are all describing behavioral outcomes.  While this question may contain multiple reasons, it does not appear to require an answer that accounts for all of them.  2. Moreover, each of the answer choices are specific to buying alcohol, and it's not clear whether the given reasons are consistent with someone who is not buying alcohol.  For example, we cannot assume that "being buying beer" means "being arrested", because the latter is a condition of buying alcohol, but not the former.  Likewise, "intoxication" cannot be used to explain someone who is not buyer but who is instead being arrested, which requires explanation itself.  3. In the current context, the only answer choice that accounts for these reasons is E, which involves the pleasure associated with drinking alcohol.  4. Thus, the answer to this question is E: pleasure.<n><n>### Input (part 2):What should you do when your boss comes around without any warning or notice? Choices: 1. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:Bill is stuck in marsh when a man comes up to him peaking Cajun, where is he? Choices:  A: low lands B: new york C: forest D: louisiana E: everglades<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**Question**:<n>Cajun?<n>**Answer**:<n>New York, New York.<n><n>### Input : <n>The youngsters did a good job of cleaning the yard.<n><n>### Response<n><n>**Question** <n>Who did a good job?<n><n>**Answer** <n>The youngsters.<n><n>### Feedback:<n>The response to the question has been provided with the following:<n>1. Parenthetical expression (who did...) <n>2. Indirect object (did a good job...)<n>3. Verb (did...)<n>4. Object (of did, good job...)<n>5. Subject word (the youngsters...) <n>6. Comma (of...)	<n><n>### Instructions<n>Write a grammatically perfect response to the given instruction in a conversational style.<n>### Context:<n>John likes to write novels but has never had the time to write one. He wants to start writing a book and asked for help.<n><n>### Note:<n>Careful with comma (do… to…) and sentence fragments.<n><n>### Example<n>The teacher told the child that they weren’t going to have time for a lesson after the lunch break. A. Were they not going…?<n><n>### Answer:<n>The teacher told the boy that they weren’tre going to have time for learning after the lunch break, though they were free to write books if they wanted.<n><n>### The task:<n>The teacher told me that they weren’te going to have time for the next class.<n><n>### Proposed answer:<n>The teacher told you that they weren’ting going to have time for next class, though you’re free to go on reading if you want to. <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The question indicates that John did everything required of him but it was in a perfunctory manner, suggesting a lack of detail or thoroughness.<n>2. It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:When eating everything on the tasting menu, what does one tend to feel? Choices:  A: full stomach B: getting full C: gaining weight D: sick E: satisfaction<n><n>### Response:		<n>When eating everything on tasting menu what one tends to feel: full stomach<n><n>### Instructions:Answer each question completely.<n>### A person who is "tapped" for the role of CEO has met the requisite criteria, usually of higher seniority, but is not yet anointed.<n>### A CEO who "taps" a person for a new position suggests the person is well qualified, often more so than other candidates that might have also been considered.<n>### A resignation without a notice period, while leaving on good terms is sometimes called a "quiet" resignation, as in'she gave her two week notice and will quietly leave', not'resignation with notice'.  Though, in some countries, a resignation can simply 'have no notice', meaning no notice.<n>### In golf, 'carry' is the term that applies to carrying the ball, while 'drive' relates to hitting it from the tee.<n>### While most jobs are acquired, a few are won - this could be more descriptive, or it could refer to games like billiards.<n>### In a tournament of golf, 'playoff' does not refer to finishing on even par; it refers to overtime, though one might think such as the above paragraph would dissuade one to think such a tournament would have a playoff for the championship.<n>### The word 'fell' is an infrequently used verb.<n>### 'Waterfalls' and 'battles' are uncountable nouns, but while a 'river of molten lava' can be said to have many rivers, one does not refer to the 'river of molten volcano' on account of 'lava' being an uncountable noun.<n>### 'Follow the leader' is a competitive game when there is already a leader, as in, when one person is at the head of the pack, or the leader to follow; however, 'follow the leader' is also a game played in military marches when one person in the line leads the rest of the people, and everyone follows them in the march; it is not uncommon to hear military commands of the form 'take three steps forward, turn to the left and drop to a knee' with cadences such as 'follow the leader, follow the leader' - a similar command

Choices: a: to accept her invitations b: to return her phonecalls c: to visit her d: to bury her<n><n>### Answer<n>I'm not sure there is an option that is grammatically correct. I think that this response says that Margaret's friend was too "busy" to visit her. But there is no clear antecedent to "her" so it could mean either that her friend did not visit her, or that Margaret died before her friend could visit her.<n><n>### Answer:<n>B: She was too busy to *return* her phonecalls.  This makes the most sense given the question.  Her friend doesn't just say, "I'm too busy."  There is a specific example of "too busy" given, namely that her friend did not return her phonecalls after Margaret's death.  To *return* her phone calls means not to pick up the phone<n><n>### Answer 2<n>D: Margaret's friend was *too busy* to burry her.  After all is said and done, it sounds better.  It is easier to say and makes more sense.<n><n>### Original Answer: Margaret's friend didn't even bury her after her death.  But the sentence that follows makes it a bit awkward.  The subject of the sentence is'she' and the verb 'burried' is implied.  So the second clause makes more sense with the first clause, so the subject of the sentence is changed to 'Margaret's'.  The verb 'buried' is then added in the last clause.<n><n>### BETTER (IMO): Margaret's friend didn’t even bury her *after* her death.  This makes it a bit more natural and flows easier.  As it is, the sentence is a little fragmentary.  Just a little more detail on

Among the provided options A, B, C, D, and E, the answer is most likely to be D: illness or acid reflux, as these potential outcomes indicate physical ailments as a result of overeating.<n>3. While "living longer" might suggest prolonged physical health, it is unlikely to refer specifically to illnesses that are associated with eating too much dinner.<n>4. "Stomach ache" could potentially be associated with overeating, but it isn't explicitly linked to the act of eating or the context of consuming too much dinner.<n>6. Similarly, "living longer" is not specific enough to be a suitable answer since it doesn't directly refer to a specific physical reaction or outcome.<n>7. Thus, the most likely answer is D: illness or stomach ache, as these potential out outcomes are clearly associated with the act of eating too much dinner and could result in physical impacts such as illness and acid reflux.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The question indicates that John did everything required of him but it was in a perfunctory manner, suggesting a lack of detail or thoroughness.<n>2. It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:What is a grumpy person likely to have? Choices:  A: headache B: understand themselves C: compliments D: own house E: happiness<n><n>### Response:		D: own house<n><n>### Rationale:The question states that a grumpy person is likely to possess a personality trait that causes them to respond negatively to situations and people.  It is not certain what that trait is, but it is clear that it is one that the person is born with, rather than acquired.  Given this information, it is plausible that they are born with the trait due to their home environment, meaning that they likely live in a house owned by their parent(s) or another relative.  Therefore, the correct answer is "own house".<n><n>#### Extended Task:<n>Answer the following question.<n><n>## Extended Task:<n>Input: The murderer didn't realize that his shoe prints were everywhere.  He is more likely to do what? Choices: A: commit suicide B: escape C: remain silent D: kill again<n><n>#### Rationale:<n>Given the information that the murderer did not realize that his shoeprints were everywhere, it can be inferred that he was either so confident in his ability to not leave evidence or so distracted that he didn't pay much attention to his surroundings.  From this, it is possible that he was either unfamiliar with the crime scene or that he was inexperienced with murder.  Given the choice of choices, "remain silent" is the best fit to this explanation.<n><n>#### Extended Rationale: <n>The murderer is more likely to remain silent because he is likely to be new in committing murder. The murderer is more likely a newbie or new, inexperienced, or a rookie to the murder. Also, "commit suicide" does not fit the meaning the question wants, but if the murderer knew that his shoe prints are everywhere, he would escape and flee to his next target.<n>Answer: D<n><n>

Fungi are organisms that can grow in moist areas with high availability of organic materials.<n><n>### This is the correct response from the following multiple choices and could probably pass.<n><n>### The next are close to being incorrect because they have different structures in them.<n><n>### Choices below in bold are still wrong.<n><n>### Other Choices:<n><n>### Reasons why other choices are incorrect:<n><n>### The question asked where under rocks would be suitable for fungal growth, which is true under rocks does have suitable microenvironment for fungus to grow.<n><n>###

Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Choices:  A: hang up B: respond C: contact D: answer E: attracting ducks<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple-choice question. <n><n>### Rationale:1. The questions indicates that he made calls all day and hoped people would what to his offer, suggesting that he made multiple calls in hopes of getting some type of response.<n>2. Among the provided options "hang up", "respond", "contact", "answer", and "attracting ducks," the latter is the best option to describe his activity.<n>3. "hang up" does not make sense since the caller would then have to hang up himself since everyone else is hang up already.<n>4. "respond" could suggest multiple responses from different people, but we do not know if they are different responses to the same caller or multiple calls to multiple people, so this does not make sense.<n>5. "contact" might be a possible choice if there were an emergency or something serious, but in this case we can tell that he is trying to sell something so it is unlikely.<n>6. "answer" could be used to describe the end result of calls which is what we are told here "people would call and what to his offer."<n>7. However, when paired with "all day hoping", it seems unlikely since by the end of the day he is not sure of what to expect and will still be calling tomorrow.<n>8. Thus the best option is "answer."<n>9. This means that the correct answer is E: answering ducks.<n>Answer: E:answering ducks<n>

Choices:  A: closet B: library of congress C: classroom D: in bed E: desk<n><n>### Response:		<n>> Classroom.<n><n>### Explain:<n>-  The question specifies "while it is being read".<n>- Reading is often done in a classroom.<n>- Therefore, A & E are incorrect.<n>- The library of congress is not a storage place for books.<n>- Also, B is incorrect because it is not specific; it does not specify "while it is being" read.<n>- D is incorrect because it is the place in bed, not where a book is being read.<n>Thus, Classroom is the correct answer.

Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:What is someone who gets angry after getting drunk likely to participate in? Choices:  A: violence B: falling down C: vomiting D: vomiting E: lower standards<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer D!<n><n>### Demetrius, after drinking heavily, participated in vomiting.<n>It is important to note that alcohol reduces restraints on behavior, including inhibitions, tolerances to social rules, and taboos. Thus, intoxicated individuals are more likely to act in ways that are contrary to their usual behavior. <n>### One of the signs of intoxication is emotional disinhibition. This involves a person having lower than usual standards of social conduct.<n>### As a result of emotional disinhibitation, intoxicated individuals engage in acts of rage, aggression, and sexual behavior that they would not typically exhibit.<n>### Therefore, Demetrius engaging in vomiting after drinking is consistent with the personality changes that occur when intoxicated. Thus, the correct answer is D: vomiting.<n><n><n>### Inputs:The suspect's name is John Brown. Choices: A: yellow  B: pink  C: green  D: red  E: black<n><n>### Demos:<n><n>### The color of the car is black.<n>### The suspect is believed to be driving/to have driven (from the shooting) a black Chevrolets. The suspect's name is **John Brown**, thus it is important to include **B** for the description of the car.<n>### If we eliminate other colors like green, yellow and pink, the correct answer is black.<n><n><n>## Instructions:<n><n><!---Write a response that appropriately completeds the request.<n>--><n><n>## Input:Ralph is very reliable. Choices:  A: go to church B: appear in court C: watch soap operas D: paying attention E: go into court<n><n>### Response:		<n>The passage is about giving testimony of how spiritual life changed lives, so the choices to look at for possible evidence would be 1) Going to Church: You can hear testimony of...so the passage says that people can "hear testimony". The testimony of how spiritual lives changed does not mention going to church.<n>2) Appearing in court: The first paragraph states that people want to tell how their lives changed since they got saved. The choices are not about appearing in court.<n>3) Watching soap operas: Soap operas could also be life changing as they teach you a lot, but it is stated "heard testimony", so the evidence is not supported.<n>4) Paying attention: Might be life changing but not relevant to choosing the right answer.<n>5) Going into court: The passage states that people want to testify which means that people also want to tell about the changes in their lives, but the evidence is not supported with the choices since the ones mentioned are 4) Paying attention and 5) Going into Court.<n><n>The answer is 2) Appearing In Court- You can hear testimony about how your spiritual life changes when you appear in court.<n><n>Answer: 1) B<n><n>You may find it helpful to make several copies of this guide and share it with others for feedback.<n><n>###### Acknowledgments<n><n>* [Contributors](https://github.com/jaywink/codecademy-refactorings/graphs/contributors)<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: John only gave a perfunctory examination of the corpse, though he did everything required of him.  He missed the real cause of death.  He wouldn't have if he had been more what? Choices:  A: careful B: thoughtful C: complete D: thorough E: intricate<n>Rationales: 1. The question indicates that John did everything required of him but it was in a perfunctory manner, suggesting a lack of detail or thoroughness.<n>2. It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Among the provided options, "careful", "thoughtful", "complete", "thorough", and "intricate", the latter is the best fit to describe a detailed and comprehensive examination.<n>4. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Thus, the option that best fits is "thorough", suggesting that had he been more thorough, he wouldn't have missed the real cause of death.<n>9. Therefore, the answer to the question is D: Thorough.<n>Answer: D: thorough<n><n>### Input:Where would you put a folding chair if you do not plan to use it and you do not have any large doors in your house? Choices:  A: roof B: school C: beach D: closet E: garage<n><n>### Response:		(D)<n>Folding chairs are typically used for outdoor activities and events, so if you do not plan on using it or have large doors in your house, it is reasonable to put a folding chair in the closet, which is usually smaller and narrower than a garage. <n><n>### Instuction:<n><n>### Input<n>> A bicyclist is speeding down a winding road, and he can't slow down because if he did, there would be someone waiting to take his place. After rushing through a town, he reaches a fork in the road. <n>><n>> A. On one fork, the road turns left. <n>><n><n>### Response<n><n>#### Demonstration: (A): On one fork the road turns left.<n><n>#### Demon:<n>The bicyclist's situation is that he is on his way of a winding road, traveling at a certain speed, and has reached a fork in the road from which he needs to choose the direction to go. <n><n>In this scenario, the fork has two options: the road turns left, or the road turns right. <n><n>#### Reason:<n>The road turning left is chosen because the narrator mentioned the presence of another bicyclist waiting for the road to turn.<n><n>This means the road in question is a winding path with limited spaces for the cyclist to stop and turn around, so if the cyclist chooses to turn right, there is a chance that the cyclist behind him who intends to follow in his path will not be able to stop in time, resulting in a crash. <n><n>#### Rationale:<n>This reason is supported by the premise that the cyclist is traveling at a certain pace and rushing to keep up the pace. <n><n>If the cyclist wanted to slow down in a safe and controlled manner, he could always veer to either side of the road and turn around, at which point the cyclist or bicyclist behind him would have been able to stop in time and avoid a crash. <n>If this is not an option, it would be wise to turn left so that the cyclist is able to get around quickly, which he seems to be doing for fear of having another cyclist behind him. <n><n>#### Demon :<n>The other fork in the road, where the road turns

It is also mentioned that John missed the real cause of death, implying that he was not thorough enough in his examination.<n>3. Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6. Complete might suggest that he did not finish his examination, but the passage states that he did everything that was required of him.<n>7. Intricate implies complexity, but not necessarily comprehensive thoroughness.<n>8. Choices:  A: living room B: dog park C: basket D: small apartment E: big house<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### [The](http://example.com/questions/5.html#the) [small](http://example.co/questions/5.Html#small) [dog](http://example.do/questions/5.htmll#small) [felt](http://example.it/questiobs/5.htmlll#small) [like](http://example.om/questions/5.hmlll#small) [it had](http://examplo.me/questions/5.hlol/ll#small) [(1a) all the space](http://example.o/questions/5.hamllll#allthespace) [in the world] in the living room. <n><n>### Explanation:<n>* **[The](http://example4.com/questions/118.htmllllllllllllllll#the) - The indicates that the small dog felt like had all the space in a specific space, as opposed to throughout the whole world.<n>* **[small](http://example3.co/questions/1166.htmllll#small) -** This indicates that it was a small dog and that it was only feeling like it had all the room in one small space.<n>* **[dog](http://example2.do/questions/11.003.HTMLlllll#dog)** shows the subject of the phrase feels like the room is hers due to the presence of the dog.<n>* **[felt](http://exampla.me/questions/1152llllll#Felt)** indicates that the dog felt like she had all the space in which ever space referred to by the context.<n>* **[like](http://example4523.it/questions11.Html/ll#like)** indicates the dog felt as such.<n>* **[had](http://example4170528201.ml/questions/11/0000346.Htmlll#had) - This word indicates that the dog actually did have all the space in the living room, or in a larger space in which the living room was but the dog's body was in the living room.<n>* [(1a) all of the space](http://examp4.me/questions 11

Careful might suggest that he was not being cautious enough, but it doesn't fully capture the inadequacy of the examination. <n>5. Thoughtful implies a level of consideration or contemplation, but doesn't necessarily mean detail oriented.<n>6.
